results.title: Eating out
results.creator_credit: Robin James, Griffith University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dragons tongue. - Series 2.”.
The eating habits of the Chinese are illustrated through filmed and dramatised segments. We see different kinds of restaurants, factory canteens, and a Chinese family at home during mealtimes. The “History of Chinese” segment describes the different dialects and languages that exist in China emphasising that there is really only one written script for all of these. Vocabulary introduced covers day to day language concerned with mealtimes and shopping for food.

results.title: Eating
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Eating introduces the basics of good nutrition. We talk to parents about what their children eat and provide examples of good food diets.

results.title: Eating
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program contrasts food habits and agricultural conditions in China and considers how long China can continue to support a population which, despite birth control, continues to grow at an alarming rate.

results.title: Eat,Sleep and Cycle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “1976 Olympic Films”.
Riders from all over the world competed in this bicycle Marathon from Brisbane to Sydney. All the grit, determination and endurance of the riders is captured in this film. Rated: G

results.title: Eat your greens
results.brief_description: A poignant short film about the tenuous nature of families, as a husband arrives home to his disgruntled wife whose just about to serve dinner. Cast includes Elizabeth Maywald, Alan Cinis, Lauren and Mark Snell.

results.title: Eat to live
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Review: 27th year”.
Food has alway’s been man’s first preoccupation. Today, while many people get too little of the foods necessary for good health, others of us are overweight through eating too much food that has little or no nutritional value

results.title: Eat for health
results.creator_credit: Hal Kopel and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: This film introduces a new approach in teaching children to eat a well balanced diet. Using the five fingers of his hand as an always available check-off device, Ralph learns to eat a balanced diet of bread and butter or margarine; milk and cheese; meat and eggs; vegetables and fruits

results.title: Eat Art
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Play Printing”.
Backed by modern music, a group of painters silently act out movements as they create a mural piece by piece. The artwork takes form as the mural is placed on the wall until the completed artwork is seen to be food spread out on a checked tablecloth
